textRun.content: Product Cloud - M1.2 - Video Processing (Rework) - Iter#2
M1.2 - Video Processing (M1 - Upload, Download, and Stream Video)
Prod2 Change Spec - Product: Product Cloud - Replace and enhance Product video provider
What is the business value that the milestone will deliver
Video processing capabilities will be added to the Video upload mechanism with this milestone using AWS services for generating transcriptions, captions, thumbnails and video objects/scenes.
Video Transcoding and why it is critical for Streaming
Guide to Social Media Video specs
Social Media Video Specs Cheat Sheet
About the Common Media Application Format with HTTP Live Streaming
How CMAF will influence the online streaming industry
Best practices for ultra-low latency streaming with CMAF
documented in the AWS blog post

, documented in the AWS blog entry

List the milestones on which this specification depends on.
- Prod2 Change - Product: Product Cloud: Rewrite Product Authentication
- Use JWT Tokens instead of shared secrets
Use AWS S3 for storing video files
Use one bucket per region, with a separate folder for each customer
Allocate a separate folder in the customer folder for every video
Use AWS Step Functions to orchestrate the video processing steps
P1 ITD 11.1 - Configure Step Functions to emit CloudWatch events when execution state changes

As StepFunctions are interacting with external services to perform various types of processing they can be subject to intermittent failures by nature. How do ensure we are aware of these failures and implementation errors and have the opportunity to take action when needed?
Have the actions that face failures emit CloudWatch events
Log error messages that reflect the nature of the failure
Configure Step Functions to emit CloudWatch events when execution state changes

Applying custom logic to emit CloudWatch events or log messages is an error prone approach and adds excessive complexity to the solution. CloudWatch events emitted on Step Function state changes is a universal mechanism that will reflect all errors and retries that are not swallowed explicitly by respective actions.
Step Functions - CloudWatch events on state changes
P1 ITD 11.2 - Retry failed Step Function states following the policy described in
Which retry policy to we use to deal with intermittent errors during video processing?
No retries. Fail the processing immediately.
Retry failed Step Function states following the policy described in

As the operations, performed in scope of video processing involve external services which can produce intermittent errors, a retry policy is necessary in order to not damage user experience with intermittent failures on video processing on our side, in cases when the failures can be mitigated by automatically retrying, and at the same time not prolong the waiting period for the user more than it is necessary to have a certain level of confidence in the stability of the outcome.
P1 ITD 11.3 - Allow the user to publish the video as soon as it’s uploaded without waiting for any processing
Processing the uploaded video can take a significant amount of time. How do we save user’s time waiting for the video to be processed before publishing it?
Allow the user to publish the video as soon as it’s uploaded without waiting for any processing
Allow the user to publish the video as soon as
Allow the user to publish the video as soon all processing is performed

can take a significant amount of time depending on the size of the user input. It does not affect Product’s ability to publish the video and only slightly affecting user decision (providing him with an option to see the video in its final form with captions, before publishing). It is not expected to affect the decision to publish in a significant way. Delaying user’s ability to publish while performing

of the uploaded video is a less obvious decision, but at the end of the day the ability to publish the video ASAP without artificial delays is deemed valuable. User is still able to wait for the processing to complete before submitting if he so wishes.
P1 ITD 11.4 - Start Basic Processing as soon as the video is uploaded, and Complex Processing as soon as video Publishing is initiated
What strategy do we use to perform video processing to balance User Experience and resources invested in processing unused videos?
Start processing the video as soon as the video is uploaded
as soon as the video is uploaded, and
as soon as video Publishing is initiated
Start processing the video only after the video is published

When working on publishing his video, the user could benefit from having the video transcoded and available for preview as soon as possible along with thumbnails, however the outcome of complex processing (transcriptioning, captioning, object/scene detection) is not important for the user to have available as soon as possible. Distinguishing Basic and Complex processing and triggering the complex one on Publish will also help to save computing resources on processing videos, that are not going to be eventually published.
Transcode media files using AWS Elemental MediaConvert
P1 ITD 12.1 - Transcode video files into MP4 format for download
The uploaded video is going to be used for both streaming and download purposes. We need a video in CMAF format for streaming as per
. In which format do we need the file transcoded for download?
Transcode video files into MP4 format for download
No other options considered - BU requirement
Downloading videos in MP4 is a
P1 ITD 12.2 - Extract the embedded captions in WebVTT format
How do we proceed if the video, uploaded by the user has
Leave the captions embedded into the video
Extract the embedded captions in WebVTT format.
Captions extracted from the video have priority over generated captions. Captions uploaded by the user have priority over both extracted and generated captions.
Remove the embedded captions from the video. Follow the same scenario as for a no-caption video.

When the video uploaded by the user has captions embedded, we must react accordingly in order to not encounter a situation when generated/uploaded captions are displayed over the embedded captions. However the chances are high that captions already embedded into a video are created manually, and thus are of better quality, than we can provide through automation, and thus would be beneficial to reuse by removing them from the video itself, extracting them in a standard format consistent with other caption sources.
Note that it might not be possible in a case when the captions are “burned into” the video, replacing the action video pixels. This case can not be handled automatically.
AWS MediaConvert Setting Up Captions in Outputs
Transcode video files into CMAF format for streaming
Use quality-defined bit rate (QVBR) mode for AWS Elemental MediaConvert output.
Use AWS Transcribe service for transcription.
P1 ITD 15.1 - Don’t perform automatic transcription if the user has uploaded caption files explicitly or the caption files were embedded into the video

In case when the user has explicitly provided the caption files or captions were embedded into the video (not “burned in”, but embedded in an extractable way), do we still want to perform automatic transcription?
Perform automatic transcription regardless of caption availability
Perform automatic transcription as a base for generating captions in other languages
Don’t perform automatic transcription if the user has uploaded caption files explicitly or the caption files were embedded into the video.
Use them as a basis to create the translated captions.

We only want to resort to automated transcription if there’s no more high quality sources that we can rely on to create captions in multiple languages. Automatically translating the generated transcripts pipes the data through two layers of natural-language based automation, which can significantly affect the quality of the output. Therefore if we have access to captions supplied by the user directly or at least ones, already embedded in the video, we assume that they are of higher quality, that we can get by transcribing the video automatically and use it as a base for further processing.
Transcription, Translation and Captioning using AWS Transcribe + Translate
Use AWS Translate service for language translation.
Create captions in WebVTT format after translation
Use AWS Rekognition for object and scene detection
P1 ITD 18.1 - Recognize Labels, Celebrities, Text, Faces, Unsafe Content from the uploaded video using AWS Rekognition
What type of objects do we want to recognize from the uploaded video using AWS Rekognition?
Labels, Celebrities, Text, Faces, Unsafe Content from the uploaded video using AWS Rekognition

Labels, Celebrities and Text will provide us with general metadata representing the nature of the video. Faces information will open a possibility for a wide variety of scenarios involving matching the videos and community members. Unsafe Content information will provide us with information that will be useful for moderation and search optimization purposes going forward.
AWS Rekognition - Video analysis result notification
AWS Rekognition - S3 video analysing with SQS
Invoking Lambda Functions with SNS Notifications
AWS Rekognition - Types of detection and recognition
Mark a video with a processing flag to indicate it is not yet ready to view or download
P1 ITD 19.1 - Use CloudWatch to collect events from all AWS services in Basic and Complex workflows
Which services  are especially interesting for us to closely monitor from a business perspective?
Use CloudWatch to collect events from all AWS services in
No other options considered - BU priority

Product Business Unit is explicitly interested in closely monitoring the mechanisms of the new Video service. In order to achieve that use CloudWatch with the video processing services involved with the solution: AWS MediaConvert, Transcribe, Translate, Rekognition, in order to open the possibility to monitor logical errors, capacity and settings problems and open a possibility to add SNS notifications for responsible parties to be aware of the system health.
Additional level of logging will be done on Step Function level in scope of
Authentication and Access Control for AWS CloudWatch
Using CloudWatch events with AWS MediaConvert
Using CloudWatch events with AWS Transcribe
P1 ITD 10 - Create Thumbnails using AWS Elemental MediaConvert.
When the users do not upload thumbnails along with the videos on Product, how should thumbnails be generated in Product?
Create Thumbnails using AWS Elemental MediaConvert.
, no other option is being considered.
Video transcoding and thumbnail generation implemented.
Record a video demonstrating the following:
AWS UI with a visual representation of a Step Function used to orchestrate basic video processing steps
Step Function is configured to emit CloudWatch events when execution state changes
Step Function is configured with a retry policy as described in
CloudWatch events are collected from all AWS services involved with the Step Function
Video files are transcoded AWS Media Convert
The transcoded video and thumbnail files are placed into S3 into the video-specific folder:
If captions are embedded into the video, they are extracted in WebVTT format
Video is transcoded into MP4 format for download
Video is transcoded into CMAF format for streaming
QVBR mode is used for AWS MediaConvert output
S3 bucket holding the customer’s video files is in the same region as Product’s other data for a given customer
Video transcription, captioning, translation and object recognition capabilities added to the solution.
Record a video demonstrating the following:
Demonstrate the AWS UI with a visual representation of a Step Function used to orchestrate complex video processing steps
Step Function is configured to emit CloudWatch events when execution state changes
Step Function is configured with a retry policy as described in
CloudWatch events are collected from all AWS services involved with the Step Function
All the files resulting from complex processing are placed into S3 into the video-specific folder:
Video transcription is performed using ASW Transcribe
If captions have been explicitly uploaded by the user, automatic transcriptioning and captioning are not performed and user's captions are used as a source for translation and indexing
If transcriptions are disabled by the Community Administrator, automatic transcriptioning is not performed along with any video processing that depends on its results
Captions are created, translated and stored in WebVTT format for the original and each of the languages as per instance settings (
Captions are not translated in any of the languages aside the ones the ones selected on instance level
S3 bucket holding the customer’s video files is in the same region as Product’s other data for a given customer
Labels, Celebrities, Text, Faces, Unsafe Content are recognized from the uploaded video using AWS Rekognition and stored in the Video Object metadata
When  the user doesnt upload thumbnails along with the video, they are auto-generated using AWS Elemental MediaConvert.
Video processing is integrated with Product
Video processing results communicated to Product and integrated with Product Video Creation UI.
Step Function is started as soon as the video is uploaded into S3 by the means of a CloudWatch event
User is allowed to publish the video as soon as it is uploaded without waiting for any processing to complete
User is not allowed to publish the video until it is uploaded
Step Function is triggered when Publish video action is initiated by the user
Product does not allow attempts to stream the uploaded video until Basic Processing is completed.
Product does not index the video nor publishes it to a feed until Complex Processing is completed
Include the following in the demo video:
The changes are built into Product and no proxy microservices are used for communication between the new video service and Product
These demos will be evaluated according to th
N/A (Since this is a split milestone)
The diagrams below are provided as references to demonstrate the idea and the workflows.
They can be logically broken down if Engineering deems it necessary.
Appendix 2.1 - Step Function Error Retry Policy
This will allow the external service 39 seconds of grace period to recover before the job fails, while not excessively prolonging the attempts and keeping the user waiting.
Fail load video processing execution if any of data parts retrieval operations still fails after the last retry.
2) A UI gets displayed to get the user to upload captions, thumbnails etc.
3) As soon as the video is uploaded you can immediately push the "Publish" button
4) The publishing doesn't happen immediately. The video is being processed in the background - first the basic processing (MediaConvert), then complex one (captioning, translation, object detection)
5) Only when it's done the video undergoes other down-stream operations and eventually gets published to the feed
